author: Field Level Media
title: Carlos Narvaez's 11th-inning homer blasts Red Sox past Phillies
text:
Carlos Narvaez hit a two-run homer in the 11th inning to lift the visiting Boston Red Sox to a 9-8 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on Wednesday.
After both teams scored a run in the 10th, Narvaez's shot off Seth Johnson (1-1) helped the Red Sox salvage the series finale. Jorge Alcala allowed a two-out RBI single to Johan Rojas in the bottom half, but Brennan Bernardino came on and retired Max Kepler on a called third strike for his first career save.

author: @andaluciainf
title: Martínez-Almeida critica la "chulería" de Sánchez en las ayudas a Madrid por Filomena | Andalucía Información. Todas las noticias de Jaén
text: El alcalde de Madrid, José Luis Martínez-Almeida, ha criticado la "chulería" del Gobierno de España, liderado por Pedro Sánchez, en las ayudas por la borrasca Filomena en la capital mientras "agacha la cabeza" con el independentismo. Así lo ha expresado en el Pleno ordinario del Ayuntamiento de Madrid, después de que el TSJM diera la razón al Ayuntamiento de Madrid en su reclamación de ayudas por los gastos derivados de los servicios de Emergencias en la capital por la borrasca de Filomena y obligara a la Delegación de Gobierno a dictar una nueva resolución al no estar motivada la decisión de conceder solo 1,4 millones de euros, un tema que se debatirá también este viernes en el Pleno ordinario del Palacio de Cibeles. Almeida considera que la forma de actuar por parte del Gobierno de España fue "injusta y arbitraria" en esta materia, al ser "incapaces" de dictar una resolución "mínimamente motivada" que explicara las razones por las que denegaban las cantidades que se habían solicitado por parte del Ayuntamiento. "No motivar la resolución es un acto de arbitrariedad, pero también es un acto de chulería, la chulería del gobierno de Pedro Sánchez, que mientras agacha la cabeza frente al independentismo en Waterloo, sin embargo, a los madrileños no nos quiere ni explicar las razones por las que no quiere compensar los daños causados por Filomena en esta ciudad", ha censurado al alcalde ante una pregunta del portavoz del Grupo Municipal Popular, Carlos Izquierdo. Así, ha insistido en que no hay "madrileño más desagradecido que Pedro Sánchez" porque no tuvo ninguna reunión con el alcalde pese a los efectos que tuvo Filomena en la ciudad y lo que hizo fue "bajarse de un coche frente al Ministerio de Interior e iba con mocasines". "Tuvo que pegar dos saltitos para no mojarse los mocasines, entrar en el Ministerio, tener una reunión sin contacto con el Ayuntamiento y con la comunidad, y volver al coche pegando saltitos con los mocasines, porque no fue capaz de hacer absolutamente nada por esta ciudad", ha censurado. Considera Martínez-Almeida que Sánchez prefiere estar "con (Carles) Puigdemont, (Oriol) Junqueras, con Koldo y con (José Luis) Ábalos" porque es "el jefe de la banda" de la "corrupción en estado puro". "Sánchez es el jefe de la banda que se niega a decirle a los madrileños por qué nos deniega 59 millones de euros por los daños de Filomena. Nosotros, que lo tenga claro señor Sánchez, seguiremos haciendo frente a este Gobierno, y lo seguiremos haciendo desde las instituciones, desde las calles, desde los tribunales y desde la aplicación del Estado de Derecho y de la Democracia", ha señalado el regidor. Por su parte, Izquierdo ha puesto el foco en que Sánchez ha "abandonado la ciudad" también durante la pandemia o con el servicio de Cercanías. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Redacción Deportes
title: Policía de Miami arresta y revela primeras fotos de los colombianos que se habrían colado en final de Copa América
text: El pasado 14 de julio se disputó la final de la Copa América 2024 en los Estados Unidos, en la que Argentina se impuso 1-0 ante Colombia en un gran partido que se jugó en el Hard Rock Stadium de la ciudad de Miami. Lastimosamente, antes del pitazo inicial se vivieron momentos de caos a las afueras y al interior del recinto deportivo por cuenta de miles de hinchas que entraron a la fuerza.Faltando poco tiempo para el inicio del juego, se comenzaron a viralizar videos en las redes sociales mostrando a mujeres, niños y hombres llorando por cuenta de lo que se estaba viviendo. Finalmente, la situación se pudo controlar y el partido inició con más de una hora de retraso, un episodio que empañó la final y la fiesta que se vivió durante los día previos. Desde ese momento, la Policía inició las respectivas investigaciones logrando identificar a más de 8.000 personas que se vieron inmersas en esto y que, por ende, tendrán duras sanciones.Al parecer, este hombre saltó los torniquetes, se resistió a la fuerza y evitó que algunos oficiales lo capturaran, para posteriormente darse a la fuga. Sin embargo, presuntamente agredió a un oficial de la Policía, aunque su familia sostiene que él compró la boleta de manera legal y todo es un error. Otros capturados fueron identificados como Angie Torres, Julián Jaramillo, Carlos Andrés Gutiérrez, Elkin Fernando Castañeda Ruiz y Cobo Ibarra Silva. Aunque mucho se ha especulado sobre las posibles sanciones a estas personas, medios norteamericanos apuntan a que varios serán expulsados del país y también tendrán fuertes sanciones económicas.

author: Priyanka Patel
title: Linux Distro Shuts Down: Sad News for Users
text:
Linux Distro Announces Shutdown Another specialized Linux distribution has ceased operations, adding to the growing list of discontinued projects.
A specialized Linux distribution has announced its shutdown. This news follows a trend of several niche Linux projects winding down operations. The specific distribution’s discontinuation marks another entry into the growing graveyard of abandoned operating systems.
What is the latest Linux distribution to shut down? A specialized Linux distro has announced its shutdown.
A Growing Trend The tech landscape is witnessing a decline in some specialized operating systems. This particular shutdown highlights the challenges faced by niche software projects in maintaining their development and community support. Many factors can contribute to such decisions, including funding, developer resources, and evolving user needs.
The operating system’s closure serves as a reminder of the dynamic nature of software development. Projects often start with enthusiastic communities but can face hurdles that lead to their eventual cessation.
A specialized Linux distribution has announced it is shutting down. This event contributes to a larger trend of discontinued niche Linux projects. The closure reflects challenges faced by specialized software development. This situation underscores the difficulty in sustaining specialized software. It also raises questions about the future of other similar projects. Keeping niche operating systems alive often requires consistent effort and a dedicated user base.
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Deportes LR
title: Resumen: Liverpool se impone con remontada 3-1 sobre Leicester City
text:
Resumen: Liverpool se impone con remontada 3-1 sobre Leicester City
Este jueves, Liverpool venció por 3-1 a Leicester como anfitrión, en el duelo correspondiente a la fecha 18 de Inglaterra - Premier League 2024-2025. Las primeras acciones de Leicester City resultaron en la apertura del marcador, con un gol de de jugada de Jordan Ayew (5' 1T). Sin embargo, la entrega colectiva de Liverpool dio frutos y el equipo terminó celebrando un 3 a 1. Tres disparos a cargo de Cody Gakpo (45' 1T), Curtis Jones (3' 2T) y Mohamed Salah (36' 2T), permitieron la remontada y festejo final de la escuadra comandada por Arne Slot.
Jordan Ayew hizo vibrar al estadio con su definición, en el minuto 5 de la primera etapa. Un centro de Stephy Mavididi dejó al volante para definir desde el área grande y meter el balón en el arco defendido por Alisson Becker.
La suerte no estuvo del lado de Liverpool en dos oportunidades y los remates de Andrew Robertson pegaron en el palo.
Mohamed Salah se distinguió como el jugador más destacado del encuentro. El volante de Liverpool metió 1 gol, efectuó 33 pases correctos y buscó el arco contrario con 6 disparos.
Otro jugador importante en el partido fue Curtis Jones. El mediocampista de Liverpool fue el autor de 1 gol, acertó 36 pases correctos y remató al arco 3 veces.
El director técnico de Liverpool, Arne Slot, planteó una estrategia 4-5-1 con Alisson en el arco; Trent Alexander-Arnold, Joe Gomez, Virgil van Dijk y Andrew Robertson en la línea defensiva; Ryan Gravenberch, Alexis Mac Allister, Mohamed Salah, Curtis Jones y Cody Gakpo en el medio; y Darwin Núñez en el ataque.
Por su parte, los dirigidos por Ruud Van Nistelrooy se pararon con un esquema 4-5-1 con Jakub Stolarczyk bajo los tres palos; James Justin, Conor Coady, Jannik Vestergaard y Victor Kristiansen en defensa; Boubakary Soumaré, Harry Winks, Jordan Ayew, Bilal El Khannouss y Stephy Mavididi en la mitad de cancha; y Patson Daka en la delantera.
El juez seleccionado para el partido en el estadio Anfield fue Darren Bond.
Liverpool visitará a West Ham United en la próxima jornada. Por el lado de Leicester jugará de local frente a Manchester City.
Terminado el encuentro, el equipo local queda con 42 puntos y primero en la tabla de posiciones. En tanto que la visita tiene 14 unidades y ocupa el décimo octavo lugar en el torneo.
Cambios en Liverpool
- 77' 2T - Salieron Curtis Jones por Dominik Szoboszlai y Darwin Gabriel Núñez Ribeiro por Diogo José Teixeira da Silva
- 85' 2T - Salieron Andrew Robertson por Kostas Tsimikas y Ryan Gravenberch por Wataru Endo
- 91' 2T - Salió Alexis Mac Allister por Harvey Elliott
Amonestados en Liverpool:
- 36' 1T Joe Gomez (Sujetar al rival para impedirle avanzar), 13' 2T Andrew Robertson y 34' 2T Dominik Szoboszlai (Sujetar al rival para impedirle avanzar)
Cambios en Leicester City
- 63' 2T - Salió Bilal El Khannouss por Facundo Buonanotte
- 64' 2T - Salió Harry Winks por Oliver Skipp
- 86' 2T - Salió Stephy Mavididi por Bobby Armani De Cordova-Reid
- 94' 2T - Salió Conor Coady por Memeh Caleb Okoli
Amonestados en Leicester City:
- 43' 1T Jordan Ayew (Sujetar al rival para impedirle avanzar) y 12' 2T Jannik Vestergaard (Sujetar al rival para impedirle avanzar)

author: @kktv11news
title: WANTED: Sex offender with last known address in Colorado Springs sought
text: WANTED: Sex offender with last known address in Colorado Springs sought The Colorado Bureau of Investigation is asking for help with tracking down sex offenders. COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. (KKTV) - Each month, the Colorado Bureau of Investigation (CBI) updates its list of the “100 Most Wanted Sex Offenders.” “The purpose of the Colorado Bureau of Investigation Sex Offender Fugitive Unit is to provide analytical and/or investigative assistance to any local, state, or federal law enforcement agency regarding the identification, location, and apprehension of convicted sex offenders out of compliance with their registration requirements,” part of the [CBI’s website reads](https://cbi.colorado.gov/sections/investigations/sex-offender-fugitives). A 24-hour tip line is available to report information and you can remain anonymous: 303-239-5732. Or you can email [CDPS_CBI_FugitiveTips@state.co.us](mailto:CDPS_CBI_FugitiveTips@state.co.us). This week we featured number 87 on the list Danny Limonez, whose last known address was in Colorado Springs. View the latest list below: Copyright 2024 KKTV. All rights reserved.

author: Elizabeth Yuko
title: The Wright Brothers’ Sister Played a Key Role in Their Success | HISTORY
text: More than a century after making the [first controlled, sustained flights](https://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/first-airplane-flies) of a heavier-than-air aircraft, Wilbur and Orville Wright remain household names and key figures in the narrative of early 20th-century American innovation and ingenuity. But the [Wright Brothers](https://www.history.com/topics/inventions/wright-brothers) didn’t simply glide over the sandy beaches surrounding Kitty Hawk, North Carolina and into the history books. With interest in aeronautics reaching new heights, and the race to conquer the skies growing increasingly crowded and competitive, the Wright Brothers’ designation of being [“first in flight”](https://www.history.com/news/history-faceoff-who-was-first-in-flight) was far from inevitable. Wilbur and Orville may have achieved this aviation milestone with a 12-second flight, but establishing their legacy took decades—and the contributions of their sister, Katharine, who brought a different set of skills to the table. The Wright Siblings' Early Bond Born in Dayton, Ohio in 1874, Katharine was the youngest of five siblings, and Bishop Milton Wright and Susan Koerner Wright’s only surviving daughter. This meant that when Susan died of tuberculosis in 1889, the responsibility of running the Wright household fell to 15-year-old Katharine. At the same time, she also began [assisting her father professionally](https://www.nps.gov/parkhistory/online_books/daav/chap3.htm), managing his finances and mail during the several months each year he spent out of town on church business. At that point, Reuchlin and Lorin, the eldest Wright brothers, had left home, and Wilbur and Orville, who were seven and three years older than Katharine, respectively, ran a printing business, and opened a bicycle shop in 1892. “The three youngest [Wright siblings] were virtually inseparable,” says Sara Fisher, executive director of the [International Women's Air & Space Museum](https://iwasm.org/) in Cleveland, Ohio. “They were close in age, they grew up together, [and] they had a shared trauma of losing their mother so early.” Despite Katharine’s responsibilities at home, she stayed on top of her studies. “Katharine was the epitome of what was known at the time as the ‘ [Republican mother](https://wams.nyhistory.org/building-a-new-nation/navigating-the-new-government/republican-motherhood/)’—the idea that women need to be educated so that they could go on and educate their male children to be good voting citizens of the republic,” Fisher explains. “Yes, she did oversee the house, but she did something that none of her brothers did: she went to college.” After graduating from Oberlin College in 1898, Katharine returned to Dayton, where Wilbur and Orville had begun experimenting with mechanical flight. She got a job teaching high school Latin and English, and resumed her domestic duties. “By running a household for her brothers and her father, she made it possible for them to pursue their work, often while away from home,” says Alex Heckman, vice president of museum operations for [Dayton History](https://www.daytonhistory.org/), the private nonprofit organization that operates the [Wright Brothers National Museum](https://www.daytonhistory.org/visit/things-to-see-do/wright-brothers-national-museum/) and [Hawthorne Hill](https://www.daytonhistory.org/visit/dayton-history-sites/hawthorn-hill/), among other local historical sites. While housekeeping may not have been Katharine’s most visible contribution to her brothers’ careers, as lifelong bachelors, Wilbur and Orville would likely have been at a distinct disadvantage had she not taken on the various forms of invisible labor otherwise reserved for wives. But thanks to their sister, the Wright brothers could focus on running the bicycle shop and building a flying machine. Presenting the Wright Brothers In [September 1900](https://www.loc.gov/collections/wilbur-and-orville-wright-papers/articles-and-essays/the-wilbur-and-orville-wright-timeline-1846-to-1948/1890-to-1900/), Wilbur and Orville made their first trip to Kitty Hawk to test their flying machine, returning the following summer for their next round of experiments. Their initial findings were published in two scientific journals in July 1901, and Wilbur, who had authored the articles, was invited to present them to the Western Society of Engineers in Chicago that September. Uncomfortable with public speaking, Wilbur was ready to decline until Katharine “nagged him into going,” as she put in a [Sept. 3 1901 letter](https://archive.org/details/miracleatkittyha0000wrig_n1z4/page/44/mode/2up?q=katharine) to their father. “She also helped dress Wilbur—who notoriously didn't care about fashion—in Orville’s nicer clothing so he looked presentable when he addressed the engineers,” Heckman says. Their first successful flights were still two years away, but Katharine was confident in her brothers from the beginning. Plus, as she told their father in the same letter, the meeting would provide Wilbur with the opportunity to “get acquainted with some scientific men,” which “may do him a lot of good.” That turned out to be an understatement. “The talk became one of the most important addresses in the history of aeronautics,” former Wright State University professors Patrick B. Nolan and Ronald Geibert write in their 2002 book [Kitty Hawk and Beyond: The Wright Brothers and the Early Years of Aviation](https://corescholar.libraries.wright.edu/books/150/). “Wilbur's speech brought the Wrights' name out of obscurity.” Katharine Supports Orville After Crash For the next several years, Katharine continued to teach, manage the Wright household, and encourage her increasingly famous brothers in their aviation endeavors. This included having a more active role at the bicycle shop, along with their brother, Lorin. But everything changed on [September 17, 1908](https://www.loc.gov/resource/mss46706.05001/?sp=166), when Orville’s plane crashed during a test flight at Fort Myer in Arlington, Virginia—leaving him seriously injured, and killing his passenger, Lt. Thomas Selfridge, an Army aeronautical expert. As soon as Katharine heard the news, she took a leave of absence from her teaching job, and “rushed to be at his hospital bedside and make sure that he was receiving the quality of care he needed,” Heckman says. Katharine stayed with Orville for his entire seven-week hospital stay, then traveled with him back to Dayton, while he was still reliant on a wheelchair. That December, Wilbur, who had been in France demonstrating the brothers’ airplane, [wrote to Katharine](https://www.loc.gov/resource/mss46706.02068/?sp=46&st=image&r=-0.178,0.686,1.392,0.618,0) suggesting that she accompany Orville to Europe, and act as their “social manager.” They made the trip about a month later, after Katharine stepped away from her teaching position for the final time, and Orville was well enough to travel. Katharine Promotes Brothers in Europe Katharine’s people skills were a critical component of this, and other trips she took with her brothers. “She had a very outgoing personality, and was really warm and engaging,” Heckman says. “Wilbur and Orville were both a little more reserved. They weren't showmen, or the kind to promote themselves, and I think Katharine was there to help make those connections.” Although Katharine provided occasional comments to the press— [before](https://archive.org/details/sim_los-angeles-times_the-los-angeles-times_1908-09-12/page/n3/mode/1up?q=%22katherine+wright%22+orville), [during](https://archive.org/details/sim_flight-international_1909-03-13_1_11/page/140/mode/2up?q=%22katherine+), and [after](https://archive.org/details/sim_literary-digest_1914-11-21_49_21/page/1004/mode/2up?q=%22katharine+wright%22) the European tour—Fisher says that she didn’t serve as the Wright brothers’ marketing manager or press secretary—at least in an official capacity. “While her brothers were shaking hands and making the rounds talking to European diplomats, royalty, and other inventors, her role was to engage with folks and describe what they had just seen her brothers do in the air in an informal, accessible way,” she explains. Ultimately, Katharine wore many hats— [literally](https://corescholar.libraries.wright.edu/special_ms1_photographs/1697/) and figuratively—while in Europe, taking on “the responsibilities of social secretary, hostess, promoter, diplomat and advocate for her brothers,” according to [an article](https://blogs.libraries.wright.edu/news/outofthebox/2013/09/17/katharine-wrights-legacy/) from Wright State University Libraries’ Special Collections and Archives. Furthermore, by joining Wilbur for a [February 1909 flight](https://corescholar.libraries.wright.edu/special_ms1_photographs/402/) in Pau, France, Katharine publicly demonstrated her confidence in her brothers and their aircraft, only six months after Orville’s crash. It was only her first of several trips on a Wright Flyer. Within a month of returning to Dayton, the Wright siblings traveled to Washington, D.C. in June 1909, where President [William Howard Taft](https://www.history.com/topics/us-presidents/william-howard-taft) presented Wilbur and Orville with medals from the Aero Club of America. Katharine, whom the president [referred to as](https://edan.si.edu/slideshow/viewer/?eadrefid=NASM.XXXX.0324) “the most important member of the family” at the event, provided her brothers with her usual moral support and social guidance. Katharine Wright's Role as Archivist High-profile events aside, much of Katharine’s work took place out of the public eye. While Wilbur and Orville set and broke flight records, she helped track them, starting at least as [early as 1901](https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=mdp.39015003322461&seq=133&q1=katharine). “In 21st century terms, we’d call her their ‘records manager,’” Fisher says. “She was like their archivist: keeping detailed records of her brothers’ successes in the telegrams and letters [they wrote] back and forth to one another, as well as their correspondence with other folks.” Fortunately, some of the people Katharine corresponded with regularly also kept decades’ worth of letters, telegrams, and other documentation—including [aviation journalist Earl Findley](https://www.nytimes.com/1956/07/12/archives/earl-n-findley-aviation-editor-us-air-services-publisher-is.html), who worked with and befriended the Wright family, and held onto a [collection of his written communication with Katharine](https://wright.libraryhost.com/repositories/2/resources/1047) from 1915 to 1928. The letters begin three years after Wilbur’s untimely death from typhoid fever at the age of 45 [in 1912](https://www.daytondailynews.com/local/photos-coverage-of-wilbur-wrights-1912-death-and-funeral-from-the-pages-of-the-dayton-daily-news/57UGFHU6LNF53JISFIHJZCZW6M/), and provide a glimpse into Katharine’s dedication to securing her brothers’ place in history. Much of their early correspondence centers on Katharine’s attempts to get Orville to cooperate with Findley on an accurate, comprehensive [authorized biography](https://www.gutenberg.org/files/67672/67672-h/67672-h.htm) of the Wright brothers. She also provides Findley with detailed updates related to the Wright Company’s [ongoing patent-infringement lawsuits](https://scholar.smu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1683&context=jalc), as well as Orville’s feud with the [Smithsonian](https://airandspace.si.edu/stories/editorial/what-happened-original-wright-flyer) over who invented the [first airplane capable of flight](https://siarchives.si.edu/collections/siris_sic_3048), which began in 1915 and lasted until 1942. “Katharine wasn't interested in pursuing the patents herself, but through her record-keeping, she was [able to] help support Orville and their attorney during the patent disputes, ensuring Orville and Wilbur got credit for what they created,” Fisher explains. “She was integral to why we know her brothers’ names as a first in modern heavier-than-air flight today.” Katharine Wright’s Legacy Despite spending a portion of her life in the public eye, it wasn’t long before Katharine was relegated to a footnote in her brothers’ story—if she was mentioned at all. But in recent decades, that started to change. The [International Women’s Air & Space Museum](https://iwasm.org/wp-blog/), for example, has housed an exhibit on Katharine since [March 1989](https://www.instagram.com/p/CM2KSsrghU9/). A replica of the lace dress she [wore to the White House](https://iwasm.omeka.net/items/show/1324) in 1909 to meet President Taft, along with photos and some of her personal belongings, are currently part of the display, which serves as the starting point for tours of the museum, Fisher says. “Katharine represents the multitude of ways that women can be part of our collective air and space history,” she explains, “and all the new ways that women can be involved now.”

author: Katie Jerkovich
title: ‘Horrified’: Oscar Winner And Other Hollywood Stars React To Overturned Weinstein Rape Verdict
text: Oscar winner Mira Sorvino and other Hollywood stars reacted to a decision by the New York Court of Appeals to overturn [Harvey Weinstein](https://www.dailywire.com/news/new-york-appeals-court-tosses-harvey-weinstein-rape-conviction)’s 2020 rape verdict. In a post on [X](https://x.com/MiraSorvino/status/1783518840984584428) on Thursday, Sorvino wrote that she was “horrified” by the court’s decision to overturn the 2020 rape conviction of [Weinstein](https://www.nytimes.com/live/2024/04/25/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-appeal?smid=tw-nytimes&smtyp=cur#weinsteins-accusers-express-fury-and-disappointment-over-the-courts-ruling) due to the court’s failure to give the [disgraced movie mogul](https://www.dailywire.com/topic/harvey-weinstein) a fair trial by allowing allegations from accusers not connected to the charges against him to testify. “Day after #DenimDay honoring sexual violence survivors, Harvey Weinstein’s conviction overturned, due partly to ‘Molineux witnesses’ testifying to prior bad acts, like lioness Annabella Sciorra,” Sorvino’s post read, referring to a term meaning “witnesses in a trial who are allowed to testify about criminal acts that the defendant has not been charged with committing,” The New York Times [noted](https://www.nytimes.com/live/2024/04/25/nyregion/harvey-weinstein-appeal?smid=tw-nytimes&smtyp=cur#weinsteins-accusers-express-fury-and-disappointment-over-the-courts-ruling). “Since when don’t courts allow evidence of pattern of prior bad acts to be admitted?” she added. “He’s a prolific serial predator who raped/harmed 200+women! Disgusted w/justice system skew [to] predators not victims.” Horrified!Day after [#DenimDay]honoring sexual violence survivors,Harvey Weinstein’s conviction overturned,due partly to molyneux witnesses testifying to prior bad acts,like lioness Annabella Sciorra.Since when don’t courts allow evidence of pattern of prior bad acts to be… [pic.twitter.com/yIoF6u76da] — Mira Sorvino (@MiraSorvino) [April 25, 2024] In a second post, the actress wrote, “Harvey Weinstein’s 2020 rape conviction overturned by New York court of appeals, retrial ordered, dissenting opinions speak volumes,” and included an [Entertainment Weekly](https://ew.com/harvey-weinstein-rape-conviction-overturned-new-york-8638799?utm_source=social2&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=shareurlbuttons) article with the voice of one of the dissenting judges, who claimed in her dissent that “fundamental misunderstandings of sexual violence perpetrated by men known to, and with significant power over, the women they victimize are on full display in the majority’s opinion.” “By whitewashing the facts to conform to a he-said/she-said narrative, by ignoring evidence of defendant’s manipulation and premeditation, which clouded issues of intent, and by failing to recognize that the jury was entitled to consider defendant’s previous assaults, this Court has continued a disturbing trend of overturning juries’ guilty verdicts in cases involving sexual violence,” she added. [CLICK HERE TO GET THE DAILYWIRE+ APP](https://onelink.to/dwapp) Following the appeals court announcement, the Silence Breakers, a group of Harvey Weinstein survivors, released a statement about the “unjust” decision. “The news today is not only disheartening, but it’s profoundly unjust,” the [statemen](https://variety.com/2024/film/news/harvey-weinstein-accusers-react-conviction-overturned-1235981941/)t read. “But this ruling does not diminish the validity of our experiences or our truth; it’s merely a setback. The man found guilty continues to serve time in a California prison. When survivors everywhere broke their silence in 2017, the world changed. We continue to stand strong and advocate for that change…” Actress Ashley Judd, who was the first to make allegations against Weinstein in 2017, called the news “unfair to survivors,” the Times noted. “We still live in our truth,” Judd said. “And we know what happened.” It’s “a terrible reminder that victims of sexual assault just don’t get justice,” [Katherine Kendall](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/10/us/gwyneth-paltrow-angelina-jolie-harvey-weinstein.html), an actress who made allegations against Weinstein, said. “I’m completely let down by the justice system right now. I’m sort of flabbergasted. But the important thing is that we do not stop speaking out. Our culture needs to keep supporting silence breakers.” Actress Amber Tamblyn, who also spoke out during the #MeToo movement, called the decision “a loss to the entire community of women who put their lives and careers on the line to speak out.”

author: News Desk
title: WATCH: Karachiites witness spectacular halo around sun
text: A stunning solar halo, known as a "sun halo," is currently visible in the skies over Karachi. Meteorologists attribute this phenomenon to the presence of high-altitude cirrus clouds over the city. These clouds contain ice crystals that scatter sunlight, creating the halo effect observed. What is a solar halo? A solar halo, also referred to as a "22-degree halo," is an optical phenomenon resulting from the refraction of sunlight by millions of hexagonal ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere. The halo forms a ring around the sun or moon with a radius of approximately 22 degrees. How Does a solar halo form? These halos are specifically formed by cirrus clouds, which are thin, wispy clouds located at altitudes above 20,000 feet. The ice crystals in these clouds act like prisms and mirrors, reflecting light in specific directions, and creating the halo effect. Why does a solar halo appear? A solar halo occurs when sunlight is refracted by ice crystals. During this process, the halo can sometimes split into different colours. The ice crystals act like prisms, bending and reflecting light in such a way that a ring forms around the sun. Historically, solar halos were used to predict weather before modern meteorological instruments. The appearance of a halo often indicated impending rain within the next 24 hours. What does a solar halo look like? When viewed from the correct angle, a solar halo can resemble a rainbow. Sometimes, it appears as a simple white ring, but it often displays a spectrum of colours. This is the collective reflection of light by the multitude of ice crystals in the atmosphere. The solar halo currently visible in Karachi is a breathtaking display of nature's optical phenomena, captivating residents and providing a rare opportunity to witness this atmospheric wonder. COMMENTS Comments are moderated and generally will be posted if they are on-topic and not abusive. For more information, please see our [Comments FAQ](/comments-policy)

author: greenmedinfo
title: Coconut water has the potential to reduce blood sugar and diabetic retinal damage.
text:
[Coconut water has the potential to reduce blood sugar and diabetic retinal damage.](/article/coconut-water-has-potential-reduce-blood-sugar-and-diabetic-retinal-damage) - GreenMedInfo Summary
Effects of coconut water on blood sugar and retina of rats with diabetes.
PeerJ. 2021 ;9:e10667. Epub 2021 Jan 29. PMID:
33575128
Yanan Dai
BACKGROUND: This study aimed to evaluate the effects of coconut water on the general condition (fasting blood sugar and body weight) and retina of diabetic rats.
METHODS: Forty-eight Sprague-Dawley male rats were divided into normal controls (NC), diabetes mellitus (DM), diabetes+coconut water (DM+CW), and diabetes+glibenclamide (DM+Gli) groups. After 4 weeks of normal feeding, coconut water was given to group III-DM+CW and 0.6 mg/kg glibenclamide to group IV-DM+Gli. The blood sugar, body weight, total retinal thickness, pathological changes, and VEGF expression in the retina were analyzed at different time points.
RESULTS: The fasting blood sugar was 4-6 mmol/L in group I-NC and continuously increased in group II-DM, whereas gradually decreased after the 4th experiment week in the remaining two groups. The rats, except in group I-NC, have lost weight. In group II-DM, the total retinal thickness was significantly increased after the 8th and 12th experiment week, and the pathological changes in retina were observed. VEGF was almost fully expressed in the ganglion cell layer and inner granular layer and partially expressed in the outer granular layer in group II-DM, and mainly expressed in the ganglion cell layer and inner layer in group I-NC, with a lighter color. Group III-DM + CW and group IV-DM + Gli demonstrated similar VEGF expression as in group I-NC.
CONCLUSIONS: Coconut water has the potential to reduce blood sugar and diabetic retinal damage, serving as a candidate drug or nutrient for treating diabetes and its complications.
[Coconut Water : CK(66) : AC(24)](/substance/coconut-water) [Hypoglycemic Agents : CK(5366) : AC(1338)](/pharmacological-action/hypoglycemic-agents)
